title: Fargo
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Leading Role
Best Writing, Screenplay Written Directly for the Screen
description: Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the pregnant Marge Gunderson.

title: The English Patient
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Supporting Role
description: At the close of WWII, a young nurse tends to a badly-burned plane crash victim. His past is shown in flashbacks, revealing an involvement in a fateful love affair.

title: Trainspotting
description: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out, despite the allure of the drugs and influence of friends.

title: Jerry Maguire
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
description: When a sports agent has a moral epiphany and is fired for expressing it, he decides to put his new philosophy to the test as an independent agent with the only athlete who stays with him and his former colleague.

title: Sling Blade
oscars_won_details: Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material Previously Produced or Published
description: Karl Childers, a simple man hospitalized since his childhood for the murder of his mother and her lover, is released to start a new life in a small town.

title: Shine
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Leading Role
description: Pianist David Helfgott, driven by his father and teachers, has a breakdown. Years later he returns to the piano, to popular acclaim if not critical acclaim.

title: Secrets & Lies
description: A successful black optometrist, adopted as a child, seeks out her birth mother and discovers she is a white factory worker in a lower-class neighborhood.

title: Breaking the Waves
description: Oil rig worker Jan is paralyzed in an accident. His wife, who prayed for his return, feels guilty; even more, when Jan urges her to have sex with another.

title: Independence Day
description: The aliens are coming and their goal is to invade and destroy Earth. Fighting superior technology, mankind's best weapon is the will to survive.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet, Prince of Denmark, returns home to find his father murdered and his mother remarried to the murderer, his uncle. Meanwhile, war is brewing.

title: Primal Fear
description: An altar boy is accused of murdering a priest, and the truth is buried deep beneath several layers of secrets.

title: Scream
description: A year after the murder of her mother, a teenage girl is terrorized by a new killer, who targets the girl and her friends by using horror films as part of a deadly game.

title: A Time to Kill
description: In Canton, Mississippi, a fearless young lawyer and his assistant defend a black man accused of murdering two white men who raped his ten-year-old daughter.

title: Sleepers
description: After a prank goes disastrously wrong, a group of boys are sent to a detention center where they are brutalized; years later, they get their chance for revenge.

title: The Rock
description: A mild-mannered chemist and an ex-con must lead the counterstrike when a rogue group of military men, led by a renegade general, threaten a nerve gas attack from Alcatraz against San Francisco.

title: Star Trek: First Contact
description: The Borg travel back in time to prevent Earth's first contact with an alien species. Captain Picard and his crew pursue them to ensure that Zefram Cochrane makes his maiden flight at warp speed.

title: Swingers
description: Wannabe actors become regulars in the stylish neo-lounge scene; Trent teaches his friend Mike the unwritten rules of the scene.

title: Lone Star
description: When the skeleton of his murdered predecessor is found, Sheriff Sam Deeds unearths many other long-buried secrets in his Texas border town.

title: Kolya
description: A confirmed bachelor and ladies' man loses his place in the state orchestra and must make ends meet by playing at funerals and painting gravestones. A sham marriage leaves him with a five-year-old stepson.

title: When We Were Kings
description: A documentary of the 1974 heavyweight championship bout in Zaire, "The Rumble in the Jungle," between champion George Foreman and underdog challenger Muhammad Ali.

title: Paradise Lost: The Child Murders at Robin Hood Hills
description: A horrific triple murder in West Memphis, Arkansas, leads to the trial of three teenaged suspects who become known as the West Memphis Three.

title: Shall We Dance?
description: A successful but unhappy Japanese accountant finds the missing passion in his life when he begins to secretly take ballroom dancing lessons.

title: Big Night
description: Two brothers gamble on one special night to try to save their Italian restaurant.

title: Bound
description: Tough ex-con Corky and her lover Violet concoct a scheme to steal millions of stashed mob money and pin the blame on Violet's crooked boyfriend Caesar.

title: Hard Eight
description: Professional gambler Sydney teaches John the tricks of the trade. John does well until he falls for Clementine, a cocktail waitress.

title: Waiting for Guffman
description: An aspiring director and the marginally talented amateur cast of a hockey town's pageant wait for someone from Broadway to see their performance.

title: The Birdcage
description: A gay cabaret owner and his drag queen companion agree to put up a false straight front so that their son can introduce them to his fiancée's right-wing moralistic parents.

title: From Dusk Till Dawn
description: Two criminals and their hostages unknowingly seek temporary refuge in a truck stop populated by vampires, with chaotic results.

title: Mission: Impossible
description: An American agent, under false suspicion of disloyalty, must discover and expose the real spy without the help of his organization.

title: Romeo + Juliet
description: Shakespeare's famous play is updated to the hip modern suburb of Verona still retaining its original dialogue.

title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
description: The story of a controversial pornography publisher and how he became an unlikely defender of free speech.

title: Michael Collins
description: Neil Jordan's historical biopic of Irish revolutionary Michael Collins, the man who led a guerrilla war against the UK, helped negotiate the creation of the Irish Free State, and led the National Army during the Irish Civil War.

title: Evita
description: The hit musical based on the life of Eva Perón, a B-picture actress, radio actress, and eventually, the wife of Argentine president Juan Perón.

title: Matilda
description: A girl gifted with a keen intellect and psychic powers uses them to deal with her crude, distant family and free her kind teacher from their sadistic headmistress.

title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
description: A deformed bell-ringer must assert his independence from a vicious government minister in order to help his friend, a gypsy dancer.

title: Happy Gilmore
description: A rejected hockey player puts his skills to the golf course to save his grandmother's house.

title: Mars Attacks!
description: Earth is invaded by Martians with unbeatable weapons and a cruel sense of humor.

title: Space Jam
description: In a desperate attempt to win a basketball match and earn their freedom, the Looney Tunes seek the aid of retired basketball champion, Michael Jordan.

title: The Crucible
description: A salem resident attempts to frame her ex-lover's wife for being a witch in the middle of the 1692 witchcraft trials.

title: Twister
description: Bill and Jo Harding, advanced storm chasers on the brink of divorce, must join together to create an advanced weather alert system by putting themselves in the cross-hairs of extremely violent tornadoes.

title: Fly Away Home
description: A father and daughter decide to attempt to lead a flock of orphaned Canada Geese south by air.

title: Emma
oscars_won_details: Best Music, Original Musical or Comedy Score
description: While matchmaking for friends and neighbors, a young 19th Century Englishwoman nearly misses her own chance at love.

title: The Nutty Professor
description: Grossly overweight professor Sherman Klump, desperate to lose weight, takes a special chemical that turns him into the slim but obnoxious Buddy Love.

title: DragonHeart
description: The last dragon and a disillusioned dragonslaying knight must cooperate to stop an evil king, who was given partial immortality.

title: That Thing You Do!
description: A Pennsylvania band scores a hit in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as it can, with lots of help from its manager.

title: Beautiful Girls
description: A piano player at a crossroads in his life returns home to his friends and their own problems with life and love.

title: Set It Off
description: Desperation drives four inner-city women to bank robbery in Los Angeles, then they start mistrusting each other.

title: James and the Giant Peach
description: An orphan who lives with his two cruel aunts befriends anthropomorphic bugs who live inside a giant peach, and they embark on a journey to New York City.

title: The First Wives Club
description: Reunited by the death of a college friend, three divorced women seek revenge on the husbands who left them for younger women.

title: Ransom
description: When a rich man's son is kidnapped, he cooperates with the police at first but then tries a unique tactic against the kidnappers.

title: The Craft
description: A newcomer to a Catholic prep high school falls in with a trio of outcast teenage girls who practice witchcraft, and they all soon conjure up various spells and curses against those who anger them.

title: Kingpin
description: A star bowler whose career was prematurely cut short hopes to ride a new prodigy to success and riches.

title: Courage Under Fire
description: A U.S. Army officer, despondent about a deadly mistake he made, investigates a female chopper commander's worthiness for the Medal of Honor.

title: Eraser
description: A Witness Protection specialist becomes suspicious of his co-workers when dealing with a case involving high-tech weapons.

title: 101 Dalmatians
description: An evil high-fashion designer plots to steal Dalmatian puppies in order to make an extravagant fur coat, but instead creates an extravagant mess.

title: Beavis and Butt-Head Do America
description: Our dim-witted heroes go on a cross-country search for their stolen TV.

title: Ghosts of Mississippi
description: The widow of murdered civil rights leader Medgar Evers and a district attorney struggle to finally bring the killer to justice.

title: One Fine Day
description: Two strangers and their young children are thrown together for a hectic day in New York City.

title: The Portrait of a Lady
description: A young American woman travels to Europe, where she falls victim to a machiavellian plot by two American expatriates.

title: Looking for Richard
description: Al Pacino's deeply personal and highly acclaimed cinematic look at William Shakespeare's "Richard III".

title: Microcosmos
description: A documentary of insect life in meadows and ponds, using incredible close-ups, slow motion, and time-lapse photography.

title: The Mirror Has Two Faces
description: A professor who enters a platonic marriage with a colleague falls in love with him, but he doesn't reciprocate until she undergoes a physical transformation.

title: The Preacher's Wife
description: An angel comes to earth to help a preacher save his church and his marriage.

title: Ridicule
description: A French engineer must curry favor with the court of Louis XVI to get funding for his project, learning that wit is the key to success.
